item.title: Report E-2025040577
item.description:
Report E-2025040577

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: DALTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SUPERIOR TRANSPORTATION LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8700
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The driver noticed material on the tire of his trailer during his pre-trip inspection. The driver immediately stopped the leak from the drum. A spill response contractor was called to the location of the trailer, since the driver did not have the equipment needed to remove the leaking drum from the trailer. The spill contractor found the leaking drum, removed it from the trailer, placed the leaking drum into an overpack, and then cleaned up the material on the inside and outside of the trailer. The overpack was placed back in the trailer. A minimal amount of material, less than 1 gallon, was released below the trailer. The rest of the material was contained to the inside of the trailer. Upon observation of the drum, it looks like there was a very small puncture in the side of the drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040649
item.description:
Report E-2025040649

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-25
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2025, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the released product into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pails were containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: On April 17, 2025, one (1) 50-gallon cylinder of UN2401 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew secured the valve, then utilized absorbent pads and cleaning agents. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040458
item.description:
Report E-2025040458

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 50-Gallon DM containing hazardous product, ROCRYL 410. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 20-gallon release onto the entire wooden trailer floor and concrete beneath the trailer in a 12 x 10 area as a result of a clamp puncture during the off-loading process. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and used absorbents pads to clean the trailer. One 85-gallon DF containing the overpacked damaged leaking was generated for waste disposal. One 55-gallon DM containing impacted oil dry and absorbent pads was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
